paper_abstract: We show that the diameter diam(G(n)) of a random labelled connected planar graph with n vertices is equal to n(1/4+ o(1)), in probability. More precisely, there exists a constant c > 0 such that P(diam(G(n)) is an element of (n(1/4-is an element of), n(1/4+is an element of))) >= 1 -exp(-n(c is an element of)) for is an element of small enough and n >= n(0)(is an element of). We prove similar statements for 2-connected and 3-connected planar graphs and maps.
paper_title: On the Diameter of Random Planar Graphs
